wikipedia_page.main: Alfred Allport (12 September 1867 – 2 May 1949) was an English rugby union forward who played club rugby for Blackheath and international rugby for England. In 1890 Allport became one of the original members of the Barbarians Football Club. He also represented Surrey at County level.

link_mentions.page: List of England national rugby union players

response: In 1891, North was invited to play with the two most important teams of his career; the Barbarians and England. When Carpmael set about forming an invitational touring team, he turned to his old sporting friends from Blackheath, North was one of several players to accept, several had played alongside him against the New Zealanders in 1889, including Alfred Allport, Aubone Surtees and Johnny Hammond.
